chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joel Zarza Lopez was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Joel Zarza Lopez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $100.00 per month beginning 6-15-2015 on all Clark County cases. Defendant was directed to stop at the Clerk of Courts after noon on Thursday 5-7-2015 to retrieve his payment plan and judgments AND to provide the Court with a current address.
Payment plan of $100.00 beginning 6-15-2015 granted on all Clark County cases.

Defendant granted huber privileges and is to granted credit for 23 days served. Jail sentence on counts 1&3 to run concurrent to each other.
Concurrent with:  Jail sentence on counts 1&3 to run concurrent to each other.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Joel Zarza Lopez, appeared via video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in person in court.    Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant will seek an attorney
Initial appearance on February 12, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  Defendant is not to possess any identification information except his own.
